description: Her 34-year-old beau singled her out when he won a People's Choice Award last Wednesday
title: Golden Globe 2016 winner Lady Gaga forgets to thank fiancé Taylor Kinney
title_page: Golden Globe 2016 winner Lady Gaga forgets to thank fiancé Taylor Kinney | Daily Mail Online
text:
A visibly stunned Lady Gaga stumbled through the acceptance speech for her first-ever Golden Globe win on Sunday night.
The 29-year-old pop diva won for her role as the blood-lusting hotelier The Countess in FX's American Horror Story: Hotel.
'I feel like Cher in that John Patrick Shanley movie Moonstruck,' the Cheek to Cheek songstress said onstage the Beverly Hilton.
Scroll down for full list of winners and video
'This is one of the greatest moments of my life!' A visibly stunned Lady Gaga stumbled through the acceptance speech for her first-ever Golden Globe win on Sunday night
Her reaction: The 29-year-old pop diva seemed to be genuinely taken aback by her win
Checking in? The Artpop singer won for her role as the blood-lusting hotelier The Countess in FX's American Horror Story: Hotel
'This is one of the greatest moments of my life...I am really and truly speechless.'
Gaga - born Stefani Germanotta - confessed she 'wanted to be an actress before a singer, but music worked out first.'
Even so, Mother Monster still beat Sarah Hay, Felicity Huffman, Queen Latifah, and Kirsten Dunst in the Best Actress in a Limited-Series or TV Movie category.
The Cheek to Cheek songstress said onstage the Beverly Hilton: 'I feel like Cher in that John Patrick Shanley movie Moonstruck'
Close to tears: Gaga - born Stefani Germanotta - confessed she 'wanted to be an actress before a singer, but music worked out first'
What a feeling: Lady Gaga seemed to be utterly taken aback by the awards win
Better luck next time? Even so, Mother Monster still beat Sarah Hay, Felicity Huffman, Queen Latifah, and Kirsten Dunst in the Best Actress in a Limited-Series or TV Movie category
Robert Rodriguez muse: It's an impressive feat for the Applause Singer, whose only prior roles were Bertha in Sin City: A Dame to Kill For last year,and La Camaleón in Machete Kills in 2013
It's an impressive feat for the Applause Singer, whose only prior roles were Bertha in Sin City: A Dame to Kill For last year,and La Camaleón in Machete Kills in 2013.
And while Gaga managed to thank her family, cast, and 'wonderful human being' AHS creator Ryan Murphy - she forgot fiancé Taylor Kinney.
The omittance was particularly noteworthy since the 34-year-old actor singled her out when he won a People's Choice Award for Favourite Dramatic TV Actor last Wednesday.
Oops! And while Gaga managed to thank her family, cast, and 'wonderful human being' AHS creator Ryan Murphy (L) - she forgot fiancé Taylor Kinney
'My fiancée couldn't be here tonight, but she says hello': The omittance was particularly noteworthy since the 34-year-old actor singled her out when he won a People's Choice Award last Wednesday
Accepting Favourite Dramatic TV Actor, the Chicago Fire hunk told the Microsoft Theater: 'I love you babe, thank you for having my back and supporting me. You inspire me every day'
'Thank you fro being right there for me the whole way through!' However, she did give Kinney a shout-out in her follow-up Instagram post
'My fiancée couldn't be here tonight, but she says hello and wishes she could,' the Chicago Fire hunk told the Microsoft Theater.
'I love you babe, thank you for having my back and supporting me. You inspire me every day.'
However, she did give Kinney a shout-out in her follow-up Instagram post: 'Thank you Taylor for being right there for me the whole way through.'
Hours earlier, the affectionate couple of five years put on quite the PDA show on the red carpet.
Kisses for the camera: Hours earlier, the affectionate couple of five years put on quite the PDA show on the red carpet
Taylor told DailyMail.com Wednesday: 'We keep on, back and forth on [wedding] dates, and I think it’ll just be a surprise'
Triumphant: Gaga exaggerated her 5ft1in hourglass figure with a corseted and padded black Atelier Versace gown selected by her stylist of seven years, Brandon Maxwell
'Looking fierce with their Globes!' Backstage, the newly-minted winner hung out with Empire's Taraji P. Henson, who took home best actress in a drama for her role as Lyon family matriarch Cookie
Erased her ink! Even more impressive, Lady Gaga covered up all of the tattoos on the left side of her body with body make-up
Understated: The normally wigged-out singer wore her natural locks in a Marilyn Monroe style and kept her lips nude for the glitzy ceremony
'We keep on, back and forth on [wedding] dates, and I think it’ll just be a surprise,' Taylor told DailyMail.com Wednesday.
Gaga exaggerated her 5ft1in hourglass figure with a corseted and padded black Atelier Versace gown selected by her stylist of seven years, Brandon Maxwell.
After the six-time Grammy winner's Cher shout-out, the 69-year-old pop icon tweeted 'SO PROUD GAGA #BIRDSOFAFEATHER' to her 2.9M followers.
After the six-time Grammy winner's Cher shout-out, the 69-year-old pop icon tweeted 'SO PROUD GAGA #BIRDSOFAFEATHER' to her 2.9M followers
That's Amore! Cher - born Cherilyn Sarkisian - raised a lot of eyebrows back in 1988 when she took home an Academy Award for her performance in the Italian-American drama
And AHS actor Matt Bomer, whom Gaga also name-dropped, tweeted: 'Congratulations to one of the great artists of our time @ladygaga on her very well deserved @goldenglobes award! You did it!! @AHSFX'
Werk! The G.U.Y. belter also singled out her high-heel strutting co-star Dennis O'Hare, who plays eccentric transgender bartender Liz Taylor
The 53-year-old Emmy nominee tweeted: 'Congrats to @ladygaga and @MrRPMurphy and all of the @AHSFX family'
Let's party! The platinum blonde later hung out with Dennis and Matt at the Fox afterparty
Cher - born Cherilyn Sarkisian - raised a lot of eyebrows back in 1988 when she took home an Academy Award for her performance in the Italian-American drama.
And AHS actor Matt Bomer, whom Gaga also name-dropped, tweeted: 'Congratulations to one of the great artists of our time @ladygaga on her very well deserved @goldenglobes award! You did it!! @AHSFX'
The G.U.Y. belter also singled out her high-heel strutting co-star Dennis O'Hare, who plays eccentric transgender bartender Liz Taylor.
'Congrats to @ladygaga and @MrRPMurphy and all of the @AHSFX family,' the 53-year-old Emmy nominee tweeted.
Face to face: Ryan Murphy's campy-horror series is also up for Best TV Movie or Limited-Series - competing against American Crime, Fargo, Flesh and Bone, and Wolf Hall
The thrilling conclusion: Catch more of the two-time Emmy nominee on the fifth season finale of American Horror Story: Hotel, which airs Wednesday on FX
Ryan Murphy's campy-horror series is also up for Best TV Movie or Limited-Series - competing against American Crime, Fargo, Flesh and Bone, and Wolf Hall.
Catch more of the two-time Emmy nominee on the fifth season finale of American Horror Story: Hotel, which airs Wednesday on FX.
The 'Till It Happens to You belter - along with Diane Warren - will next compete at the February 15 Grammy Awards for Best Song Written For Visual Media (rape documentary The Hunting Ground).
And catch more of Kinney as Lieutenant Kelly Severide in the fourth season of Chicago Fire, which continues January 19 on NBC.

Celebrating: Lady Gaga kissed her golden globe with an air of celebration
Picture perfect: Her black gown was understated and worthy of an awards ceremony red carpet
Winner, winner: The pop star was no doubt still in disbelief
Woman of the moment: She couldn't help but enjoy her moment in the spotlight
